    • Constructor Detail

      • Rotor

        public Rotor(java.lang.String code,
     char[] newNotch)
        Constructor. Accepts a string representing the wiring of the rotor in the forward direction and determines the reverse wiring. The string is automatically converted to uppercase but is not otherwise checked for validity. Also accepts the location of the carry notches. Rotors have 0-2 carry notches. The default notch location is '!', which represents no-notch.
        Parameters:
        code - A string representing the initial forward mapping of the rotor. Characters in the string map to the letter in the corresponding position of the actual alphabet.
        newNotch - A character array indicating the locations of the carry notches. Arrays should always have a length of 2. '!' indicates that carry notch is not used.

    • Method Detail

      • getNotchPosition

        public char[] getNotchPosition()
        Getter method for the current notch positions.
        Returns:
        A two-character array indicating the current notch positions. '!' indicates no notch.

      • getRingSetting

        public char getRingSetting()
        Getter for the ringSetting.
        Returns:
        Character indicating the ring setting.

      • getPosition

        public char getPosition()
        Getter for the current position of the rotor.
        Returns:
        A character representing the current position of the rotor. This corresponds to the character that would be displayed for that particular rotor on the top of the Enigma Machine.

      • setRingPosition

        public void setRingPosition(char newPosition)
        Sets the current ring setting, which rotates the rotor's replacement map relative to its default position.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - A character indicating the offset. In the Enigma Machine, this would be the letter that a mark on the side of the rotor would be aligned with.

      • setStartPosition

        public void setStartPosition(char newPosition)
        Sets the starting position of the rotor.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - A character indicating the starting position of the rotor. This would be the letter visible on the top of the Enigma Machine before the operator begins entering the text to be encrypted.

      • cycleRotor

        public boolean cycleRotor()
        Rotates the current rotor and returns a boolean indicating whether the rotor to the left of it should also be rotated.
        Returns:
        true if the rotor is in the carry notch position, indicating that the rotor to the left of it should also be rotated.

      • forwardEncrypt

        public char forwardEncrypt(char letter)
        Returns the proper forward-encryption substitution based on the rotor's position and ring setting.
        Parameters:
        letter - Letter to be substituted.
        Returns:
        Letter to be passed to the rotor to the left of the current rotor, or to the reflector.

      • reverseEncrypt

        public char reverseEncrypt(char letter)
        Returns the proper reverse-encryption substitution based on the rotor's position and ring setting.
        Parameters:
        letter - Letter to be substituted.
        Returns:
        Letter to be passed to the rotor to the right of the current rotor, or the lightboard.
